evidence.source_document: Plaintiffs' Motion for a Preliminary Injunction
evidence.text: Pursuant to Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 65, Plaintiffs National Academy of Education and National Council on Measurement in Education hereby move for a preliminary injunction against Defendants, the U.S. Department of Education and Linda McMahon in her capacity as Secretary of Education.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs National Academy of Education and National Council on Measurement in Education filed a Motion for a Preliminary Injunction on May 2, 2025, requesting the Court to enjoin Defendants from cancelling IES contracts, maintain data collection activities, and restore employee positions to comply with congressional mandates.

evidence.text: 16 | 2025-05-05 | MOTION to Stay by DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, LINDA MCMAHON. (Georgiev-Remmel, Dimitar) (Entered: 05/05/2025)

extracted.value: Defendants Department of Education and Linda McMahon filed a Motion to Stay on May 5, 2025, seeking to halt proceedings pending further review.

evidence.text: 1 | 2025-04-24 | COMPLAINT against All Defendants ( Filing fee $ 405 receipt number ADCDC-11640852) filed by NATIONAL ACADEMY OF EDUCATION, NATIONAL COUNCIL ON MEASUREMENT IN EDUCATION.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs National Academy of Education and National Council on Measurement in Education filed a Complaint on April 24, 2025, initiating the lawsuit against the Department of Education and Linda McMahon, seeking relief for the cancellation of IES contracts and data collection activities.

evidence.text: 30 | 2025-07-21 | AMENDED COMPLAINT against All Defendants filed by NATIONAL ACADEMY OF EDUCATION, NATIONAL COUNCIL ON MEASUREMENT IN EDUCATION.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed an Amended Complaint on July 21, 2025, updating their claims following the denial of the Motion for Preliminary Injunction, with the amended complaint seeking continued relief on updated factual grounds.
